page.title: 09Cross Keys Area
page.content: On the road down to Delph, which is the{old main road from Manchester to {Leeds,}there is a factory owned by Cunnington and Cooper who make metal components for the nuclear fuel industry. There are also a public house called the{'Cross Keys'}which also serves food in its restaurant. Most of the buildings in the area date from the{late 18th Century and {Victorian}times built mainly of the local{Millstone Grit.}The increasing popularity of the area as a{dormitory for Oldham has resulted in many more modern houses being built in recent years. In the bottom of the valley is the River Tame and the disused track of the old{'Delph Donkey'}railway line which connected Delph to Oldham.
